title: Progress 4 GL utvecklare
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vi söker erfarna Progress-utvecklare till Financial Services i Stockholm. Hos oss på CGI får du arbeta med spännande uppdrag inom försäkring och finans, där teknik, affärsnytta och personlig utveckling går hand i hand.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som Progress Developer blir du en viktig del av vårt team och får arbeta med hela utvecklingsprocessen – från krav och design till utveckling, test och förvaltning. Du kommer både att vidareutveckla befintliga lösningar och bidra till nyutveckling, framför allt inom vårt försäkringsverktyg WinSure.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Gedigen erfarenhet av Progress OpenEdge 4GLoch Progress RDBMS
* Goda kunskaper i GIT
* Erfarenhet av Azure DevOps
* Erfarenhet av försäkringssystem, gärna WinSure
* Minst 10 års erfarenhet som systemutvecklare inom finans/insurance är meriterande


 Som person är du nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och trivs i konsultrollen. Du är trygg i din kompetens men vill ständigt utvecklas – både själv och tillsammans med kollegor och kunder.
   

  

**Varför CGI?**
 Vi erbjuder en kultur som bygger på samarbete, kunskapsdelning och balans i livet. Hos oss får du:
   

  

* Arbeta i inspirerande uppdrag tillsammans med kunniga kollegor
* Tillgång till program för karriär- och kompetensutveckling
* Möjlighet att påverka och växa i en stark global organisation


 Det finns möjlighet till hybridarbete, vilket innebär en flexibel kombination av arbete på kontoret och på distans. Det är en fördel om du är baserad i Stockholm, men vi välkomnar även ansökningar från andra delar av landet!
   

  

 Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens lösningar inom försäkring? Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att höra av dig till rekryterande chef Susann Edvardsson Alpsten på susann.edvardsson@cgi.com
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Health Systems Service Delivery Manager — Sweden
description:
Job Title
   

  

 Health Systems Service Delivery Manager — Sweden
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a
 **Service Delivery Manager** 
 you will be a vital part of our service organization in Sweden, leading a local team of Field Service Engineers.
   

  

 As the focal point for all operational service delivery related issues within the business areas of Precision Diagnostics and Image Guided Therapy, the Services Delivery Manager is responsible for executing the service delivery processes in the country ensuring maximum customer satisfaction.
   

  

 Responsible for leading the team of Field Services Engineers ensuring high level of teamwork and engagement levels.
   

  

**Your Role**
* Customer visits and communication around operational issues to assure high level of customer satisfaction
* Recognize customer needs by managing escalations and ensuring that the delivered performance and services match the customer needs
* People Management of Field Services Engineers (FSE) in the country
* Assure that all issues raised during the product lifecycle starting from product installation to maintenance are resolved, escalation management and conflict resolution
* Ensure training of new hires and FSE on ways of working, tools utilization, assuring change management related to implementation of new tools and customer services processes for the area
* Responsible for service delivery operations compliance performance within the country and for reporting compliance issues to quality & regulatory functions at regional level
* Utilizing LEAN techniques to drive operational efficiency improvements at the business and department level
* The Service Delivery Manager will also hold the role as Radiation Protection Officer (RPO) including the practical activities to ensure the safe use of radiation and to maintain the safety of the team.


**You're The Right Fit If**
* Hold a bachelor’s degree or an equivalent qualification (master’s degree in Engineering, Business, Health or related field is an advantage)
* Have at least 3 years’ experience managing a team of Field Service Engineers
* Possess strong skills in managing stakeholder relationships and achieving results within complex organizations
* Demonstrate technical expertise and a solid understanding of products and service operations within healthcare technology
* Are fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written; prior experience in the healthcare sector is highly valued


**How We Work Together**
 We believe that we are better together than apart. For our office-based teams, this means working in-person at least 3 days per week.
   

  

 Onsite roles require full-time presence in the company’s facilities.
   

  

 Field roles are most effectively done outside of the company’s main facilities, generally at the customers’ or suppliers’ locations.
   

  

 This role is classified as a field role.
   

  

**About Philips**
 We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help the lives of others.
   

  

* Learn more about our business.
* Discover our rich and exciting history.
* Learn more about our purpose.


 If you’re interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our culture of impact with care here.

title: Management Consultant - Digital Strategy and IT Operating Model
description:
**About The Role**
 As a Management Consultant in Technology Strategy & IT Operations at KPMG, you will play a pivotal role in guiding our clients through their digital transformation journeys. You will leverage your expertise in digital strategy, IT operating models, and technology transformation to help clients achieve their business objectives. This role requires a deep understanding of digital technologies, strategic thinking, and the ability to contribute and lead complex projects.
   

  

 This role is open to candidates with a range of experience levels, from early-career professionals with 2-4 years of experience, ready to take the next step, to seasoned consultants with 6-10 years of experience, looking for a new challenge. Your impact, adaptability and growth mindset matter as much as your years in the field.
   

  

 Responsibilities will be adapted based on your experience. Junior team members will focus on delivery and learning, while senior professionals shall take on engagement or project leadership, solutioning or architectural responsibilities and provide mentoring.
   

  

 The role can be placed in Stockholm or Gothenburg, depending on your location and preference.
   

  

**Our Fields of Engagement**
* Digital Strategy Development: Collaborate with clients to develop comprehensive digital strategies that align with their business goals and objectives. This includes assessing current digital capabilities, identifying opportunities for improvement or developing futuristic roadmaps for digital transformation
* IT Operating Model Design: Design and implement future ready IT operating models that enhance efficiency, scalability and agility. This involves defining organization model, governance and steering model for IT, Business-IT Alignment, IT processes, Service delivery efficiency, performance KPIs and roles that complement client's digital strategy
* IT Strategic Sourcing: Analyze and optimize IT sourcing strategy, supplier landscape and IT spend to ensure value for money. This involves conducting cost-benefit analysis, benchmarking, reviewing supplier performance and identifying opportunities for cost savings. Additionally, support client with complex and strategic sourcing initiatives (RFx process)
* CIO advisory: Build and maintain strong relationships with clients Tech/IT leadership acting as a trusted advisor. Understand CxO business and IT challenges and provide tailored and optimal solutions, insights
* Thought Leadership: Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies. Contribute to thought leadership by presenting at conferences, and participating in industry forums and developing articles, point of views and surveys


 ,
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in information technology, Business Administration, or a related field
* 2-8 years of consulting experience in Digital/Technology strategy, IT Operating model, IT Service delivery and Steering Model transformation, cost transformation, or Technology transformation roles
* Experience from top-tier consulting firms or large enterprises is preferred
* Understanding of cloud strategy and cloud transformation, emerging technologies (AI, Gen & Agentic AI, Modern Data platforms) or IT infrastructure & IT operations
* Understanding of Enterprise Architecture concepts, Industry leading platforms across functions (e.g. ERP, CRM, CPQ, e-commerce, Supply chain & Logistics, Data Platforms)
* Contribute to developing client solution/proposals into the sales process
* Contribute to practice building initiatives and broader initiatives within advisory at KPMG
* Curious with attitude of continuous learning
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Proactive, entrepreneurial and collaborative mindset
* Excellent stakeholder management skills


**Why Join KPMG**
* Global Network: Be part of a global network of professionals and gain access to international projects and knowledge sharing
* Career Development: Benefit from continuous learning and development opportunities, including training courses, mentorship programs, and career progression pathways
* Inclusive Culture: Work in an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone's ideas and contributions are valued
* Impactful Work: Make a lasting, positive impact on clients and society through meaningful and challenging work


 At KPMG, we are committed to fostering a culture of integrity, excellence, and collaboration. We believe in empowering our people to make a positive impact on our clients, communities, and society. Our values guide our actions and help us achieve our vision of being the preferred insights-led professional services firm.
   

  

 If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for digital transformation and a commitment to excellence, we invite you to join our team at KPMG and help us shape the future of our clients' businesses.
   

  

**Make a difference with us?**
 We welcome and look forward to receiving your application, if you have any questions, please contact Marie-Louise Bååth, marie-louise.baath@kpmg.se

title: Senior Service Delivery Manager - IT
description:
**Job Description**
 Welcome to SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, the perfect workplace for those passionate about technology in general and space in particular.
   

  

 With space organizations, research institutes, institutional and commercial actors as customers, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications, space consulting services, rocket and balloon systems, flight test services, satellite propulsion systems, and much more.
   

  

 SSC also has one of the world’s largest global networks of ground stations for satellite communications. We own and operate the Esrange Space Center in Kiruna, northern Sweden, with the aim of launching satellites in the near future.
   

  

**Are you fueled by a passion for people and the ambition to create an awesome workplace? Do you like new technology and the opportunity to help influence and develop the future?**
 If you answer yes to these questions, we invite you to seize the opportunity to make a significant impact as a Service Delivery Manager with focus on IT deliveries to SSC worldwide. You are offered an exciting role in a team that provides advanced technology, security and IT services to SSC and our customers. We are looking for a dedicated person who shares our core values of Customer passion, Care, Collaboration, Curiosity, and Courage.
   

  

**Job Requirements**
**YOUR ROLE**
 As the Internal Service Delivery Manager for IT, you will
   

  

* Lead initiatives and small projects involving various stakeholders.
* Act as a bridge between business units and IT to ensure alignment.
* Establish strong network to build trust and manage expectations.
* Contribute to the strategic planning and development of our IT environment.
* Design, implement, upgrade, manage and follow up on the Service Level Agreements between IT and different business units within SSC.
* Follow up on decided KPIs and report status to different stakeholders.
* Implement ITIL processes.
* Hold meetings with user communities and service delivery communities to ensure IT deliveries.
* Coordinate and lead actions between the different IT units as well as with customers.
* Ensure that all IT services, solutions, and processes meet defined quality standards and align with business objectives.


**Job Responsibilities**
**WHO YOU ARE**
 To thrive in this role, we see that you are a positive, curious, and a driving force. You communicate well in Swedish and English and enjoy working in an international environment. You are reliable and thorough and see the value in working with others. You are also well-structured, service-oriented and you achieve results through your contagious commitment and great people skills. We also see that you have previous experience of working with service delivery in a similar position.
   

  

 We believe that you have an university degree within technology and IT or equivalent knowledge gained through work experience.
   

  

**The Position Requires Broad IT Competence And Experience From**
* Microsoft environment (M365, Azure AD, etc).
* ITIL.
* Industry standards and technology for Workplace, Cyber security, Networking and Server.
* Cloud technologies.
* SaaS products and services.


 It is beneficial if you have worked with IT and cybersecurity frameworks.
   

  

**Job Benefits**
 WE OFFER YOU
   

  

* A unique opportunity to contribute to a wide range of projects and play an active role in both the Swedish and international space industry.
* An excellent opportunity for personal and career development.
* An exciting, international workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world.


**Additional Benefits**
* In addition to vacation and traditional public holidays, we offer extra paid leave throughout the year, such as time off between Christmas and New Year, Ascension Day, amounting to 6-11 extra days depending on the calendar.
* Wellness allowance of SEK 5,000 per year.
* Health benefits such as voluntary health insurance and regular health checks for eligible employees.
* Access to a benefit bike through a tax-efficient leasing program.
* Support for employee-driven activities that promote connection, health, and culture across teams.
* Collective Agreement, including good pensions plans, parental pay and insurance.


  

  

 LOCATION
   

  

 The position is located either in Kiruna or in Solna and may involve some limited and plannable travel. The position is organized in the IT Workplace & Collaboration Services team within IT.
   

  

 FURTHER INFORMATION
   

  

 For questions regarding employment terms or union-related matters, you are welcome to contact our union representatives:
   

  

 Sveriges Ingenjörer: SverigesIngenjorer-AF@sscspace.com
   

  

 Unionen: unionen@sscspace.com
   

  

  

  

 NEXT STEP
   

  

 If this opportunity sparks your interest, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible! We review applications continuously and will conduct interviews throughout the process.
   

  

 You can submit your application up until 2025-12-15, which is the latest possible date for consideration.
   

  

 Please note, however, that the position may be filled before this date, and the advertisement may therefore close earlier. This allows us to manage the process efficiently and give each application the attention it deserves.
   

  

 When applying, please include your CV. While you are welcome to include a brief personal note or letter, our evaluation will primarily focus on your skills and qualifications as outlined in your CV, ensuring a fair and unbiased recruitment process.
   

  

 This is a security-classified position and will require a background check prior to employment.
   

  

 Due to the upcoming holiday period, parts of the recruitment process may take slightly longer than usual. We appreciate your patience and will keep you updated as the process progresses.
   

  

 WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE
   

  

 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.
   

  

 With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.
   

  

 We help Earth benefit from Space. Learn more at sscspace.com

title: Product Specialist for Telecom OSS Fulfilment & Inventory (Ericsson Granite, Java)
description:
**About the job** 




  





**Role:** 
 Product Specialist for Telecom OSS Fulfilment & Inventory (Ericsson Granite, Java)
 



**Experience:** 
 6+ Years
 



**Language requirements:** 
 Swedish + English
 



  





**Tata consultancy Services** 
 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




  





 Join a high-performing telecom engineering team as a DevOps Engineer, where you will drive CI/CD automation, infrastructure modernization, and operational excellence across BSS/OSS systems. You will work on large-scale telecom platforms including billing, CRM, provisioning, and network management while enabling faster releases, high availability, and resilient operations. This role offers deep exposure to Kubernetes, cloud environments, automation frameworks, monitoring tools, and multi-vendor telecom ecosystems in an Agile and DevOps-driven environment.
 



  





**Key Job Responsibilities:** 




  




* Define and maintain the functional roadmap for EAI‑based inventory and Granite discovery (coverage, model extensions, reconciliation rules).
* Design/maintain Resource & Service Models (physical, logical, virtual) in EAI.
* Configure Ericsson Granite discovery jobs, parsers, and normalization; tune schedules and scopes per technology (IP/MPLS, optical, access).
* Define reconciliation policies (match/merge rules, conflict resolution) to ensure EAI reflects true network state.
* Specify resource assignment, capacity checks, reservation, and service design interfaces for fulfilment engines.
* Own API contracts (REST/SOAP), payload schemas (XML/JSON), and event flows for Inventory ↔ Fulfilment/Assurance/ITSM/CRM.



  





**Experience & Skills Requirements:** 




  





**Must have:** 



* Telecom OSS domain expertise in Inventory & Fulfilment: resource/service modeling, topology, reconciliation, O2A process touchpoints.
* Hands‑on with Ericsson Adaptive Inventory (EAI) configuration/customization and Ericsson Granite discovery & sync.
* Java / JavaScript proficiency to specify/validate integrations, support minor enhancements, and interpret implementation details.
* API & integration patterns: REST/SOAP, XML/JSON, message queues; idempotency, retries, and error handling.
* Data management & SQL: query tuning, integrity checks, bulk loads; understanding of Oracle/PostgreSQL backends.
* Governance & ITIL: Incident/Problem/Change; CAB participation; audit‑readiness for model and integration changes.



  





**Good to have:** 



* Exposure to TM Forum frameworks (SID, eTOM, ODA) and Service Catalog concepts.
* Familiarity with Camunda BPM (order orchestration), Assurance/NMS (NNMi/NetExpert/EXFO) for closed‑loop interactions.
* Experience with Elastic/Kibana/Grafana for inventory/fulfilment observability dashboards.
* Scripting (Shell/Python) and CI/CD awareness for configuration‑as‑code and repeatable deployments.



  





**Success Metrics & Unique Selling Proposition (USP) of The Role:** 




  




* Faster and more reliable software delivery through automated CI/CD and containerized deployments.
* Improved system stability, uptime, and SLA performance in large-scale telecom environments.
* Strong impact on cost reduction and operational efficiency through automation and infrastructure-as-code.
* Ability to lead modernization of BSS/OSS platforms using Kubernetes, cloud, and advanced monitoring tools.
* Act as a key driver connecting development, operations, and architecture teams for DevOps excellence.



  





**What we offer / What’s in it for you:** 




  




* Opportunity to work on large-scale telecom platforms with modern DevOps and automation technologies.
* Exposure to cloud, Kubernetes, monitoring ecosystems, and next-gen BSS/OSS modernization initiatives.
* Collaborative environment with cross-functional and global engineering teams.
* Continuous learning and career growth supported by certifications and complex project exposure.
* Ownership of strategic DevOps initiatives with direct impact on operational performance and delivery speed.



  





**Does that sound interesting?** 




  





 You are welcome to submit your application consisting of your CV, personal letter, relevant degrees or certifications details, professional references, etc. We work with ongoing recruitment so send in your application as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application via LinkedIn or mail to
 **aswini.ranganathan@tcs.com**

title: Field Sales
description:
**Job Description**
**Reshape How We Win in the Independent Software Vendors (ISV) Ecosystem**
 At Nexi, we're revolutionizing how payment solutions integrate into the software that powers businesses across Europe. As part of our
 **ISV Field Sales** 
 team, you'll spearhead our next phase of growth in the Integrated Software Vendor space, bringing our innovative solutions to directly to merchants.
   

  

 This is about getting close to small businesses, helping them understand how our innovative partnerships can accelerate their growth and supporting them through the full sales cycle. It’s the perfect role for a high energy, success-driven software salesperson who thrives on face-to-face contact.
   

  

**The Challenge**
 The ISV landscape is evolving rapidly. We have partnerships across Europe with innovative providers, integrating payments into their market-leading commercial products. Now we need to take those product solutions to small and medium sized businesses across Europe, build compelling business cases to solve their problems, and supporting them through the whole sales and onboarding cycle.
   

  

 You'll be identifying and acquiring new customers while working in a busy, international environment with plenty of room for growth
   

  

**Your Mission**
**Hunt and Win ISV customers**
* Identify and engage high-potential customers in the target sectors
* Build compelling sales cases that demonstrate the value of our solutions
* Manage sales process from initial contact through successful onboarding and go live


**Drive Commercial & Technical Partnership Success**
* Develop deep understanding of ISV business models, technical requirements, and integration capabilities
* Collaborate with technical and onboarding teams to ensure seamless onboarding experiences


**Support Partnership Approach**
* Provide market intelligence that shapes our ISV strategy and product development


**Own Revenue Growth**
* Own your revenue targets and growth objectives


**What We're Looking For**
**Partnership Hunter Mindset**
* Revenue Driver: You're motivated by targets and understand how partnerships translate to business growth
* Relationship Builder: You earn trust quickly and maintain mutually beneficial relationships with a real focus on customer success
* Market Challenger: You're comfortable competing and winning in a complex technical market


**Technical & Commercial Expertise**
* Software Sales Experience: Proven track record in B2B software or SaaS sales
* Technical Fluency: Comfortable discussing technical integration requirements with customers, in clear and compelling terms, and collaborating with stakeholders across internal technical functions


**Sales Excellence**
* Track record of achieving revenue targets


**Life at Nexi**
 Discover more about us and what it's like to be part of Nexi by visiting this page: https://www.nexigroup.com/en/people/life-at-nexi/overview/?utm\_source=career-platform&utm\_medium=job-openings&utm\_content=standard .
   

  

 Learn about our values, meet our communities, and see how we are shaping the future of digital payments together.
   

  

**Apply now!**
 If this opportunity resonates with you, we'd love to hear from you!
   

  

 Please apply at your earliest convenience. We'll be reviewing applications continuously and closing the position once we've found the right fit. We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong.
   

  

 By exploring this job opening, you're one step closer to joining us. We're excited to learn more about you!

title: Software Engineering Manager - Container and Virtualisation Infrastructure
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 Our mission is to build a next-generation private cloud infrastructure, combining KVM, Ceph, and SDN technologies to create a data center scale cloud that 'just works' and provides a mission-critical cloud for edge and core enterprise deployments. We're hiring engineering managers with experience in high-quality microservice architectures and high-performance team leadership who also have deep familiarity with Linux kernel, virtualisation, storage and networking.
   

  

 LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management API/CLI. Our most effective engineers are fluent in all these layers, and able to anticipate the consequences of design and engineering choices elsewhere in a complex distributed system.
   

  

 As an engineering manager at Canonical you must have a solid technical background, but your responsibility is to run an effective team and develop the colleagues you manage. You are expected to help them grow as engineers, do important work, do it outstandingly well, find professional and personal satisfaction, and work well with colleagues and the community. Technical leadership experience and a background in software engineering are necessary prerequisites for this role. You will be expected to lead, challenge, and develop engineers, positively influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The successful candidate will have experience leading successful, collaborative engineering teams, and demonstrate the ability to solve challenging distributed systems problems and deep knowledge of Linux.
   

  

***Location***
 : This is a remote position available in EMEA and the Americas.
   

  

 What you will focus on
   

  

* Lead a team of remote engineers
* Develop talent through coaching, mentoring, feedback and hands-on career development
* Set and manage expectations with other engineering teams, senior management, and external stakeholders
* Advocate and advance modern software development practices
* Participate in the engineering process through code and architectural review
* Engage with teams at Canonical, the open source community and partners
* Work from home with global travel for 4 to 6 weeks per year for internal and external events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* You understand modern Linux cloud computing technologies, including networking, storage, containers and K8s
* You love developing and growing people and have a strong track record of doing it
* You are focused on success and the delivery of timely, high quality software
* You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
* You have strong written and verbal technical communication skills
* You have experience programming in C and/or Go.


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Head of Design – Data Centre Projects
description:
**Introducing evroc**
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European-owned hyperscale cloud.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
   

  

**Join the Pioneers**
 We’re looking for a visionary Head of Design to lead the engineering and design function for evroc’s hyperscale data centre projects.
   

  

 You will define our design philosophy, guide multidisciplinary engineering teams, and ensure every facility meets the highest standards of performance, safety, sustainability and operability.
   

  

 This is an opportunity to shape the technical blueprint of Europe’s sovereign cloud, influencing early design decisions that will impact millions of users.
   

  

**What You’ll Tackle**
* Lead and grow evroc’s multidisciplinary engineering and design team.
* Define data centre design standards, technical requirements, and engineering guidelines across all disciplines.
* Manage engineering consultancies, equipment vendors, and suppliers throughout the design process.
* Specify and customize major equipment categories, including IT racks, cooling and electrical systems.
* Ensure design decisions support constructability, commissioning, long-term operability and sustainability.
* Provide engineering input for tender packs and procurement.
* Establish engineering processes, documentation structures and review frameworks to support scalable expansion.


**Skills We Value**
* Engineering degree
* 10+ years of engineering experience, including leadership of multidisciplinary teams.
* Proven experience delivering data centre projects.
* Strong understanding of IT rack/server technology and industry trends.
* Ability to coordinate effectively with construction, operations, commissioning and procurement teams.


**Why Join evroc?**
 We offer a competitive salary and equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant energy of Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’ll enjoy an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture.
   

  

 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background – ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture – is celebrated.
   

  

 Applicants must possess a valid work permit.

title: Fullstack IoT Engineer
description:
**About Echandia Marine**
 Echandia Marine is a leading innovator in sustainable marine battery systems, providing cutting-edge technology to enable cleaner, more efficient marine transport. Our mission is to revolutionize the maritime industry through advanced battery technology, improving efficiency and reducing environmental impact.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a Fullstack IoT Engineer to join our growing software team. In this role, you will design and build scalable, high-performance applications that connect embedded systems, cloud infrastructure, and user interfaces. Your work will directly support the monitoring, diagnostics, and control of our marine battery systems and at the same time support our developing efforts in cloud with both frontend and backend work.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design and implement software for battery management system based on maritime standards
* Build robust APIs and backend services to interface with embedded systems and cloud platforms in a Linux environment.
* Develop intuitive and responsive front-end interfaces for internal tools and customer-facing dashboards.
* Collaborate with embedded, test, and systems engineers to ensure seamless integration across the stack.
* Implement secure, scalable, and maintainable software architectures.
* Contribute to DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and automated testing.
* Participate in code reviews, architecture discussions, and technical mentoring.


**Required Skills**
* Strong experience in fullstack development using modern frameworks, preferably Angular, Typescript and C#.
* Proficiency in designing RESTful APIs and working with IoT Solutions.
* Experience in developing hardware-near applications
* Solid understanding of software architecture and cyber security.
* Familiarity with data visualization, telemetry, and system monitoring tools.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


**Bonus**
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, and GCP, and with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
* Experience with Agile development methodologies.
* Experience developing embedded applications using C.
* Experience with Linux systems administration.
* Experience with CI/CD and build automation using GitHub Actions.
* Familiarity with databases (SQL and NoSQL) and message brokers such as MQTT and Kafka.
* Knowledge of maritime compliance standards.


 Echandia is challenging the maritime industry with safer electrification. Since its founding in 2018, Echandia has rapidly become a global leader in maritime battery systems, delivering nearly 70 systems for electrification projects worldwide. Our systems are tailored to optimize energy efficiency and reduce environmental impact, supporting the maritime industry’s transition towards sustainable operations. Based in Stockholm, we serve customers across the globe.

title: Channel Partner Manager Nordics      .
Senior systemimplementatör inom Contact Center
description:
*Är du skicklig på att omsätta teknik till konkreta kundlösningar? Vill du jobba i ett tajt team där idéer värdesätts och där du får vara med och driva utveckling – både hos våra kunder och inom Advania? Då är det dig vi söker! Vi letar nu efter en Systemimplementatör till vårt team inom Customer Experience (CX), med placering på vårt kontor i Liljeholmen, Stockholm.* 




  





**Systemimplementatör på Advania 🚀** 




 Inom Advanias affärsområde Customer Experience (CX) levererar vi kontaktcenterplattformar från Genesys och Cisco till våra kunder. Vi är stolta över att vara Genesys enda guldpartner i Norden.
 



  





**Som Systemimplementatör hos oss arbetar du med:** 



* Att sätta upp molnbaserade kontaktcenterlösningar och integrera dessa mot kundens övriga plattformar.
* Att ha kunden i centrum, tillsammans med nordens skickligaste specialister inom området.



  





 Du ingår i ett team där vi både jobbar med implementation av standardiserade lösningar samt med utveckling av högspecialiserade lösningar för våra kunder såsom chat/voicebots, AI-assistans för kundens medarbetare och affärssystemsintegrationer. Hos oss har du möjlighet att utforska nya tekniker och lösningar och vi välkomnar nya idéer och initiativ för att driva arbetet framåt.
 



  





**Vad vi söker hos dig ✨** 




 Vi söker dig som kan utöka och komplettera vårt team på Advania CX, och hjälpa oss i vår strävan att kunna erbjuda den bästa kundupplevelsen. Du är trygg i din roll och har förmågan att anpassa dig efter olika kunder och situationer. För att du ska lyckas i rollen som Systemimplementatör ser vi att du har minst 3-6 års erfarenhet och kunskap inom några av följande områden:
 


* IP-telefoni / SIP / WebRTC
* Kontaktcenter
* Molntjänster såsom Google Cloud / AWS
* Integration av olika system



 Det är meriterande om du har:
 


* Erfarenhet av AI i kombination med kontaktcenter.
* Högskoleutbildning inom data/IT, alternativt att du har arbetat dig till likvärdig kompetens.



  





 För att du ska trivas som bäst hos oss ser vi att du är en engagerad, positiv och ansvarstagande person med ett brinnande intresse för att skapa framtidens lösningar för kundkommunikation.
 



 Du känner dig trygg i både det svenska och engelska språket, både i tal och skrift. Tjänsten innebär resor till kunder, både nationellt och internationellt.
 



  





**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋** 




 Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.
 



  





 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut. Advania samarbetar även med Ljung & Sjöberg för en proaktiv arbetsplats kopplat till alkohol och droger.
 



  





 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.

title: Senior iOS Developer - Scale up
description:
We are looking for a senior iOS engineer to our client.
   

  

**Start date: Flexible**
**Duration. 6 months contract**
**Location; Hybrid setup from Stockholm (2-3 days in the office per week)**
**What You Will Do**
* Build new features and improve existing ones in our iOS app - used by millions of users every day.
* Write clean, efficient, and testable Swift code using both UIKit and SwiftUI.
* Collaborate closely with iOS and Android engineers, designers, QAs, backend engineers and


 product owners to deliver high-quality experiences.
   

  

* Contribute to architecture discussions and help shape how we build scalable, maintainable


 mobile software.
   

  

* Continuously refactor and modernize our codebase, adopting the latest iOS technolo gies andbest practices.
* Improve and maintain automated testing, ensuring releases are fast, stable, and reliable.
* Participate in code reviews, mentor engineers, and share knowledge across the team.
* Take part in app release coordination and ensure smooth deployments through CI/CD pipelines.


**Who You Are**
* Experienced iOS engineer (5–8 years) with a strong track record of shipping high-quality consumer apps.
* Proficient in Swift, with solid understanding of UIKit, SwiftUI, and modern concurrency (async/await).
* Strong grasp of software architecture patterns (MVVM, Clean Architecture, or similar).
* Passionate about writing clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.
* Comfortable with testing frameworks (XCTest, Snapshot tests) and CI/CD tools (Fastlane, Codemagic, GitHub Actions, Xcode Cloud).
* Curious, proactive, and eager to improve developer experience and overall app performance.
* Great communicator and collaborator who enjoys teamwork, feedback, and shared success.


 Bonus: experience with Firebase, MapKit, or StoreKit.

title: Senior fullstackutvecklare C#/SQL till team Dynamic Packaging - Ving
description:
**Till Ving letar vi efter en skicklig och driven fullstackutvecklare som vill vara en del av ett team där kvalitet, samarbete och teknisk innovation står i fokus.**
**Om tjänsten**
 Nu söker vi en engagerad och leveransfokuserad senior fullstackutvecklare till team Dynamic Packaging. Teamet ansvarar för våra Dynamiskt Paketerade resor vilket bland annat innebär att hämta hotell, flyg och kryssningar från våra partners och gör dessa säljbara.
   

  

 Vår försäljning sker primärt i våra appar/webbar - det du bygger påverkar direkt vår kundupplevelse! Hos oss jobbar vi agilt i snabba releasecykler och med continuous delivery . Teamen ansvarar för hela kedjan från kravförståelse, utveckling, deploy till förvaltning och support. Vår strategi är ”Cloud first” varför vi värdesätter kunskap om molnlösningar och Azure.
   

  

 Du får tillsammans med teamet stort inflytande över arkitektur, skalning och prestanda kring våra egen utvecklade system. Du blir en nyckelperson i ägarskapet av vårt teams system och att hålla dem moderna och uppgraderade och kontinuerligt utvecklade för att tillhandhålla ny funktionalitet.
   

  

 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

  

* Samverka med stakeholders för att förstå behov och krav
* Designa och utveckla lösningar
* Säkerställa kvalitet genom tex Codereviews, tester
* Automatisera infrastruktur och releaseflöden i Azure med IaC (Bicep m.m.), CI/CD och observability practices.
* Jobba ihop med andra team för att leverera på helheten


**Vår tekniska miljö**
 Vi är 13 utvecklingsteam på IT-avdelningen i Stockholm som tillsammans driver utvecklingen framåt. Våra system byggs i en modern Microsoft-miljö och vi arbetar med aktuella tekniker, ramverk och verktyg som .NET Core, C#, Node, Azure, React, React Native, JavaScript, GraphQL, MS-SQL och Redis.
   

  

 I linje med vår cloud-first-strategi satsar vi på skalbara och framtidssäkra lösningar där innovation, prestanda och kvalitet alltid står i fokus.
   

  

 Läs mer om
 **vår IT-avdelning här** 
 🧑‍💻
   

  

****Vem vi söker****
**Kvalifikationer:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling inom C#.NET och MS-SQL
* Intresse av arkitektur
* Tonvikt på backend och microservices
* Bekväm inom React/Typescript
* Erfarenhet av att automatisera infrastruktur och releaseflöden i Cloudmiljö (IaC, CI/CD)
* Erfarenhet av övervakning och monitorering
* Erfarenhet av DevOps
* Relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila team
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift


**Meriterande**
* Intresse för generativ AI och förmåga att driva frågor inom området
* Azure kompetens
* Testdriven utveckling (TDD)
* Parprogrammering


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Vi söker dig som är nyfiken, noggrann och kommunikativ, och som trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med andra. Du har ett genuint intresse för kodning och ser styrkan i samarbete för att nå gemensamma mål. Med ett proaktivt förhållningssätt och förmågan att se helheten bidrar du till att driva utvecklingen framåt.
   

  

 Du är en lagspelare som gärna delar med dig av din kunskap, stöttar kollegor och bidrar till en öppen och lärande kultur. Vi värdesätter om du har ett intresse för DevOps och tycker om att arbeta med frågor som rör automatisering, CI/CD och infrastruktur som kod.
   

  

****Vi erbjuder****
 Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö. Du får en omväxlande vardag tillsammans med härliga kollegor - vi arbetar i nära samarbete med andra team och verksamheten för att ge våra gäster de bästa veckorna på året. Vi har ett högt medarbetarengagemang och en härlig kultur. Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa i Nordic Leisure Travel Group!
   

  

 Läs mer om
 **vad vi erbjuder här** 
 🏄
   

  

****Övrigt****
 Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst och placerad på Vings fina huvudkontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm. Det är möjligt med distansarbete upp till 2 dagar per vecka när det passar för teamet/arbetsuppgiften.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av tester från Alva Labs – ett logiskt problemlösningstest och ett personlighetstest. Testerna utgår från vedertagen forskning och ger oss möjlighet att på ett mer objektivt sätt bedöma dina styrkor och eventuella utmaningar i relation till aktuell tjänst. Du får mer information när du skickat in din ansökan, men om du är nyfiken redan nu kan du läsa mer hos Alva Labs .**
**Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en bakgrundskontroll att genomföras.**
**🏄‍♂️ Kul på jobbet**
**🤝 Tjänstepension**
**🌎 Reseförmåner**
**🦉 Utveckling och lärande**
**💗 Well-being**
**💼 Hybrid arbetsplats**
 Läs mer om vad vi erbjuder här
   

  

 Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernenNordic Leisure Travel Group.
   

  

 I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Ving Norge, Globetrotter, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 250 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.

title: Ubuntu Linux Kernel Engineer - Silicon Enablement
description:
Ubuntu Linux, already the most popular Linux distribution in the world, is looking to increase its adoption even further by expanding the number of System On Chip (SoC) platforms supported natively and further optimising to ensure the highest performant experience for all users. There is a strong demand from silicon manufacturers such as NVIDIA, Xilinx, MediaTek, and Qualcomm to provide Ubuntu Linux to their customers and Canonical is looking to broaden its silicon enablement squads to meet this challenge. The Canonical Kernel Team - those responsible for the build, maintenance, and distribution of the Linux kernel for Ubuntu - are looking for individuals with a strong flair for software development at the hardware level and a passion for ensuring the most optimal performance the silicon can provide.
   

  

 The successful candidate will be able to prove a strong aptitude for software engineering at the hardware level. While direct experience with the Linux kernel would be a substantial advantage, it is not a hard requirement for candidates with prior background in other RTOS' or bare-metal environments as long as direct hardware experience can be demonstrated.
   

  

 There are a number of work-from-home based roles available worldwide and we are looking for experience levels from early career candidates with a couple of years under their belt up through senior industry veterans.
   

  

**What your day will look like**
* Collaborate regularly and proactively with a globally distributed team
* Work closely with our silicon vendor partners to integrate their platform support into the Ubuntu Linux kernel for their product ranges
* Diagnose and resolve issues in the kernel reported by partners, customers, the community at large, and discovered by your own rigorous testing
* Take responsibility for the delivery of distinct silicon-optimised variants of the Ubuntu Linux kernel to the world
* Improve tooling and automation for the delivery and test of Ubuntu Linux kernels
* Submit, review, and apply kernel patches, working with both internal and external upstream maintainers
* Identify new means of maximising performance on partner silicon


**What we are looking for in you**
* Well-organised and motivated self-starter able to thrive in a remote work environment
* Professional manner with colleagues, business partners, and the open-source community
* Ability to communicate effectively in English, both written and verbal
* Significant programming ability in C
* Strong grasp of device drivers, BSP's, and other aspects of hardware-level system engineering
* Solid background with git
* Understanding of operating system kernel fundamentals
* Ability to travel twice a year for company events of up to two weeks length


**Additional skills that you might also bring**
* Python and Bash scripting ability
* Prior background with the major SoC families
* Ubuntu/Debian/Snap packaging
* Demonstrated experience with Linux kernel patching and debugging
* Solid understanding of performance optimisation for silicon platforms


**What we offer you**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Home-based work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products.
   

  

 Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Senior Analytics Consultant SAP
description:
***Implema är en av Sveriges ledande specialister på snabb implementering av affärssystem som SAP och Microsoft Dynamics. Med över 20 års erfarenhet hjälper vi svenska och internationella företag att skapa effektiva och hållbara affärsprocesser. Vi har kontor på 10 orter i Sverige, 300 medarbetare, och omsätter 500 MSEK.***
 Implema växer och söker fler erfarna konsulter inom SAP Analytics! Vill du jobba i kundnära team med digitalisering och modern teknik? Då kan den här rollen vara rätt för dig! Vi söker nya kollegor till samtliga kontor från Umeå till Malmö och anpassar rollen efter dina unika färdigheter och kompetenser.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som konsult inom SAP Analytics hjälper du våra kunder att förstå och utveckla sin verksamhet med stöd av modern teknik för planering, analys och beslutsstöd. Du arbetar nära både kunder och kollegor, både juniora och seniora inom ett eller flera områden;
   

  

* Implementering av SAP Analytics-lösningar
* Workshopfacilitering för kunder och kollegor
* Support och rådgivning till befintliga kunder vid frågor, fel och vidareutveckling
* Guida kunderna i BW moderniseringsresan
* Aktivt följa SAP:s utveckling av Analytics-produkter


 Hos oss kan du välja om du vill fokusera på specialistrollen eller kombinera den med ansvar som t.ex. projektledning, mentorskap eller presales – beroende på vad som motiverar dig mest just nu i karriären.
   

  

**Är du vår nya kollega?**
 Vi letar efter dig som
   

  

* Du har flera års erfarenhet av SAP Analytics och har arbetat med lösningar som klassisk BW, BW/4HANA, planeringsverktyg, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Data Warehouse Cloud (DWC) eller Datasphere
* Du har arbetat som konsult eller på verksamhetssidan och har därmed skaffat dig gedigen, praktisk erfarenhet av att arbeta med SAP Analytics i en affärskritisk kontext
* Är flytande i svenska och engelska (tal och skrift)


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du dessutom har erfarenhet inom andra plattformar, såsom Qlik.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen har du stort intresse för området och hur detta kan bidra till att stärka våra kunders konkurrenskraft. Du uppskattar att jobba nära beslutsfattare och har förmåga att få saker att hända. Du är också en dedikerad lagspelare som värnar om högkvalitativa leveranser.
   

  

****Vad vi erbjuder?****
 Vi tror på ett arbetsklimat där kunskap delas, initiativ uppmuntras och varje medarbetare får utvecklas – både professionellt och personligt. Med höga ambitioner och högt i tak skapar vi en miljö där det är lätt att trivas. För oss är det viktigt med work-life-balance, och vi värnar om en trygg arbetsmiljö där du mår bra och känner dig sedd.
   

  

**Marknadsmässiga villkor och förmåner som stödjer dig**
 Utöver konkurrenskraftig lön erbjuder vi en flexibel hybridarbetsmodell, trygga pensions- och försäkringslösningar samt friskvårdsbidrag. Dessutom bjuder vi in på sociala aktiviteter som after work, kickoff och konferensresor
   

  

 Implema är en av Sveriges ledande specialister på att snabbt implementera affärssystem baserat på marknadens ledande affärssystem SAP och Microsoft Dynamics. Med mer än 20 års erfarenhet av affärskritiska projekt guidar Implema svenska och internationella företag till effektiva och hållbara affärsprocesser och den snabbaste vägen till framtidens affärssystem. Vi vill finnas nära våra kunder och har kontor på 10 orter runt om i Sverige och omsätter 500 MSEK. Vi växer och vill bli fler!

title: System Design Engineer
description:
**Professional Galaxy** is an IT and technology consulting company that provides highly specialized expertise in IT, software development, SAP, purchasing, electronics and mechanical design. We collaborate with experienced senior experts and deliver strategic value-creating expertise to some of Sweden's most complex and analytically demanding projects. Our focus is always on high quality, professionalism and clear, measurable results.


Are you the right person for the assignment, or do you want to recommend a strong candidate? Do not hesitate to contact us.


Feel free to apply today, selection and interviews take place on an ongoing basis.


Professional Galaxy is looking for a **System Design Engineer** on behalf of our client.  

  

The role is as system engineer in the electromobility system team, working with developing the complete electromobility driveline. The focus will primarily be for hybrid drivelines for marine use  

* Define and work with the function implementation plan for our E-Mob projects
* Develop and document unique software functions for our E-Mob applications.
* Cooperate with GTT E-mob for inheriting software functions from GTT
* Integrating components and functionality from GTT and suppliers in the platform track.
* Test and verify new functions in HIL, test rigs and real applications
* Experience of documenting in Systemweaver/SE-tool is required.
* Experience from working with Matlab/Simulink required
* Experience from developing hybrid drivelines is a merit.
* Functional safety experience is a merit.

  

Position is posted as full time but this can be discussed depending on competence level.  

Design electrical and electronics systems by identifying the purpose and aim of the system, the component interface, and system behaviors. Delivers according to defined methods, expected inputs and outputs. Lead system engineering in a technical team and play an active role in the delivery. Drive the work from an operational and short-term perspective. Integrate deliveries from others. Responsibility for securing quality and readiness before release. Participate in specification implementation and verification loops to secure system aspects of the solution. Secure that system and non-functional requirements are correctly implemented. Implement system architecture strategies and roadmaps up to the delivery in the end product. Lead concept investigations with teams. Steer exploration of alternatives to establish a system level concept together with teams. Actively support product manager in clarifying needs of capabilities/enablers and breaking down those to features/enablers. Contribute to the development of technical roadmaps and system architecture roadmaps. Lead concept investigation with teams and take the concept for approval through different decision forums. Request technical concepts and system solutions. Manage the interfaces and non-functional requirements within the scope of, for example, agile release train. On Expert level the employee is a recognized expert in System Design Engineering typically obtained through advanced education and work experience (position typically requires 10 years or more relevant experience). - Experienced project lead and an established coach, mentor and educator to others in VG - Known subject matter expert and a natural goto person for complex discipline related issues - Strong Tshaped profile (either building deeper discipline excellence or developing mature generalist toolbox) - Known product owner, often contributing to project roadmaps/strategies within context of industry trends - Clear articulation of value creation by joining up the dots between their work and the TD/BA strategy.  

Design electrical and electronics systems by identifying the purpose and aim of the system, the component interface, and system behaviors.**Other Information :**

**Duration :** 2026-01-14 to 2026-12-31

**Application Deadline** : 2026-01-06

  

Please apply directly through our system with:

Job Description
Role Summary
The Technical Engineer provides industrial application expertise and value‑selling support to Sales, delivering field‑based technical service, developing strong value propositions, and helping protect and grow business across key market segments.
Key Responsibilities
Safety & Compliance
Demonstrate strong Safety Leadership and maintain HSSE excellence.
Conduct all work ethically and in alignment with bp values and code of conduct.
Technical Support & Field Service
Serve as the industrial applications expert for internal teams and customers.
Solve process and product application issues using structured problem‑solving.
Analyse Used Oil Analysis reports and provide actionable recommendations.
Conduct field testing of new and reformulated Castrol Industrial products.
Sales Enablement & Customer Value
Support Sales in acquiring new business through technical insights and value‑selling.
Develop and document value propositions for customer opportunities.
Help retain existing business by addressing competitive threats with data‑driven solutions.
Create case studies and share best practices demonstrating customer value.
Training, Coaching & Knowledge Sharing
Deliver high‑quality technical training to internal and external partners.
Mentor less‑experienced salespeople and engineers to build organizational capability.
Product Development & Market Insights
Collaborate with Technology, Marketing, and Global Product Managers to support new product development and provide field performance feedback.
Identify local market needs and communicate product requirements.
Strategic Projects
Participate in or lead projects that support the Industrial strategy and broader business objectives.
Education

Experience & Skills
Proficiency with Microsoft Office, CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce), and engineering/sales software.
Expertise in metalworking fluids and high‑performance lubricants.
Strong communication and value‑selling capabilities.
Knowledge of sustainability topics (energy savings, water reuse, net‑zero) preferred.
Skilled in structured problem‑solving.
Strong capability in product and service knowledge, customer value demonstration, project management, and customer training.

title: Staff Software Engineer
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 Come join the PayPal Wallet Mobile Engineering team. We’re embarking on a multi-year journey to revamp wallet functionality adding valuable new features that will impact PayPal’s 350 plus million users. You will be contributing to the foundation of PayPal’s wallet for years to come guiding the team on design and architecture and contributing to the implementation that powers that functionality. Collaborating with product owners, architects, and developers of downstream systems, you will set the technical direction of the mobile wallet functionality. Your contributions will help ensure PayPal is the preferred choice for digital payments.
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Essential Responsibilities:**
* Acts as a project or system leader, coordinating the activities of other engineers on the project or within the system
* Determines the technical tasks that other engineers will follow
* Actions result in the achievement of customer, operational, program or service objectives
* Proactively improves existing structures & processes
* Exercises judgement in reconciling diverse and competing priorities (time, quality, complexity risk) to identify optimal solutions to problems
* Notices patterns and condenses repetition into densely meaningful generalized solutions
* Collaborates with management to set/improve standards for engineering rigor
* Trusted to represent PayPal, Inc to the outside world via interactions with partners, customers, or industry organizations


**Expected Qualifications:**
* 5+ years relevant experience and a Bachelor’s degree OR Any equivalent combination of education and experience.


**Additional Responsibilities And Preferred Qualifications**
 We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Staff Engineer with an in-depth understanding of iOS architecture, to join our dynamic fintech engineering team. Your expertise will drive the development of innovative features, ensuring high performance, scalability, and security in our iOS applications.
   

  

 As a Staff Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and implementing crucial features, shaping the iOS architecture that underpins our digital payment solutions. This position requires a strong technical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and a passion for staying at the forefront of mobile technology.
   

  

**Your day-to-day:**
**As an iOS Software Engineer, you will:**
* Be a strategic thinker and problem solver.
* Define and execute the mobile technology roadmap.
* Build and lead high-performing mobile engineering teams.
* Drive innovation and experimentation in mobile development.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver world-class mobile experiences.
* Mentor and coach senior engineers and foster a culture of innovation and experimentation.
* Partner effectively with product and engineering leadership to oversee mobile architecture and design.


**What you need to bring:**
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field.
* 8+ years of hands-on mobile development experience (iOS).
* Experience in designing, developing and delivering software and/or platforms (libraries)
* Deep expertise in mobile technologies and architecture.
* Solid understanding of Cocoa Frameworks
* Strong object-oriented skills including design, coding and testing patterns.
* Familiarity with database technologies (SQL and NoSQL databases) and ORM frameworks (Hibernate, JPA).
* Ability to design scalable, reliable, and maintainable software systems.
* Thorough understanding of XCode
* Proven ability to lead and influence cross-functional teams.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience with mobile payment technologies and integrations
* Proficiency in Swift, Objective-C, or React Native.
* Familiarity with continuous integration (Jenkins), application monitoring (Crashlytics and fabric.io), mocking tools (Appium and Apiary), build tool development and enhancements, using unit testing and cucumber tests for functional tests
* Familiar and comfortable with iOS technologies, the tradeoffs, and emerging design patterns.
* Knowledge of mobile performance optimization techniques.
* Strong ability to influence and inspire teams.


 PayPal does not charge candidates any fees for courses, applications, resume reviews, interviews, background checks, or onboarding. Any such request is a red flag and likely part of a scam. To learn more about how to identify and avoid recruitment fraud please visit https://careers.pypl.com/contact-us.
   

  

 For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.
   

  

**Our Benefits:**
 At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset-you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
   

  

 We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com
   

  

**Who We Are:**
 To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx
   

  

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.
   

  

**Belonging at PayPal:**
 Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.
   

  

 Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.
   

  

 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.
   

  

 REQ ID R0132783

title: Software Engineer for Telecom OSS Fulfilment & Inventory (Strucware, Wildfly)
description:
**About the job** 




  





**Role:** 
 Software Engineer for Telecom OSS Fulfilment & Inventory (Strucware, Wildfly)
 



**Experience:** 
 6+ Years
 



**Language requirements:** 
 Swedish + English
 



  





**Tata consultancy Services** 
 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




  





 Join a high-performing telecom engineering team as a DevOps Engineer, where you will drive CI/CD automation, infrastructure modernization, and operational excellence across BSS/OSS systems. You will work on large-scale telecom platforms including billing, CRM, provisioning, and network management while enabling faster releases, high availability, and resilient operations. This role offers deep exposure to Kubernetes, cloud environments, automation frameworks, monitoring tools, and multi-vendor telecom ecosystems in an Agile and DevOps-driven environment.
 



  





**Key Job Responsibilities:** 




  




* Implement new features and enhancements across Java (backend services), C (utilities/daemons), and GWT (legacy UI) components.
* Build/maintain functions for resource assignment, capacity checks, reservation, activation triggers, and post‑activation verification.
* Encode reconciliation rules that keep inventory consistent with planning/RLC outputs and operational reality.
* Ensure idempotency, retries/backoff, error handling, and stable payload schemas (XML/JSON).
* Configure WildFly: datasources, JVM tuning, thread/connection pools, logging, and health checks.
* Author unit/integration tests (JUnit/TestNG), contract tests for APIs, and regression suites covering critical fulfilment flows.Profile hotspots (CPU/memory/IO); tune SQL, caches, and asynchronous jobs to improve throughput and latency.



  





**Experience & Skills Requirements:** 




  





**Must have:** 



* Hands-on experience with Ericsson Granite and OSS Inventory concepts.
* Strong programming skills in Java and JavaScript for customizations and integrations.
* Expertise in CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps).
* Familiarity with Linux, scripting (Shell), and containerization (Docker/Kubernetes).
* Understanding of telecom OSS Fulfilment & Inventory processes and TM Forum standards (SID, eTOM).



  





**Good to have:** 



* Exposure to TM Forum frameworks (SID, eTOM, ODA) and Service Catalog concepts.
* Familiarity with Camunda BPM (order orchestration), Assurance/NMS (NNMi/NetExpert/EXFO) for closed‑loop interactions.
* Experience with Elastic/Kibana/Grafana for inventory/fulfilment observability dashboards.
* Scripting (Shell/Python) and CI/CD awareness for configuration‑as‑code and repeatable deployments.



  





**Success Metrics & Unique Selling Proposition (USP) of The Role:** 




  




* Faster and more reliable software delivery through automated CI/CD and containerized deployments.
* Improved system stability, uptime, and SLA performance in large-scale telecom environments.
* Strong impact on cost reduction and operational efficiency through automation and infrastructure-as-code.
* Ability to lead modernization of BSS/OSS platforms using Kubernetes, cloud, and advanced monitoring tools.
* Act as a key driver connecting development, operations, and architecture teams for DevOps excellence.



  





**What we offer / What’s in it for you:** 




  




* Opportunity to work on large-scale telecom platforms with modern DevOps and automation technologies.
* Exposure to cloud, Kubernetes, monitoring ecosystems, and next-gen BSS/OSS modernization initiatives.
* Collaborative environment with cross-functional and global engineering teams.
* Continuous learning and career growth supported by certifications and complex project exposure.
* Ownership of strategic DevOps initiatives with direct impact on operational performance and delivery speed.



  





**Does that sound interesting?** 




  





 You are welcome to submit your application consisting of your CV, personal letter, relevant degrees or certifications details, professional references, etc. We work with ongoing recruitment so send in your application as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application via LinkedIn or mail to
 **aswini.ranganathan@tcs.com** 




  





**Privacy Note: https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice**
